name: Pacific Conference on Language Learning
content: Second language learning and teaching is subject to many myths and misconceptions, not only among lay people but among professionals as well. Second language learning theory has developed in the last several decades to offer a foundation for humane, effective and rational language teaching strategies. This conference invites participants to share their research or practice, based on any aspect of language teaching and learning, at any level, and including observations of the importance of first language literacy as well as bilingual education.
